Talk_3003:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>All right!


My beat didn't reach the bees, but I
guess it got you moving!

With these, I can whip up a <clr:0000>honey
crepe <clr:ffff>for the conductor of my troupe
on the double.
Here's a little something for helping me
out. Take it. All yours!
Talk_1000:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Humming>Badum <sp:5:0:0>badum <sp:5:0:0>beedum! <sp:5:1:0>Badum <sp:5:0:0>badum<sp:5:0:0>
beedum. Yeah!

C'mon...<sp:5:0:0> Badum badum beedum.<sp:5:0:0> Buzz
buzza dum buzza buzza buzza dum.
Talk_3004:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>What did you say? The <clr:0000>Stable Trotters<clr:ffff>
are back in action?<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>Then what am I doing here? They need
me to bring the rhythm!<sp:0:4:0>I don't know where they are, but if I hit
up every single stable, I'll run into them
sooner or later.<sp:0:4:0>It shouldn't be long before I can offer the
troupe leader my services again!
Talk_4010:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>I am hearing that, then...<sp:5:1:0>


Maybe it's the one I'm destined to
walk through life with, calling to me in
that way!
But it can't be... It just can't be...


<sp:3:0:2:0700>I wonder where it's coming from. I've
been scouting here for the source, but I
haven't found it yet.
Talk_3005:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>I'm gonna beat it and head back to my
band leader.

I play with a group called the <clr:0000>Stable
Trotters<clr:ffff>. We bop around from stable
to stable, sharing our tunes.
I'll bet everyone's back at our old meeting
spot, <clr:0000>Woodland Stable<clr:ffff>.

It's way north over in Eldin, so I better get
a move on.

<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Greeting_00>Maybe I'll see you around. Later!
Talk_4011:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>What? You can't hear it? So that means
the sound I'm hearing...

<sp:3:0:2:0800>Maybe it's the secret sound of the one
I'm destined to walk through life with.
Could it be so...<sp:5:0:0>calling just to me?
I've got to find who it is!


<sp:3:0:2:0c01>I'll keep searching a little longer. I hear it
somewhere right around here...
Talk_1002:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Whoa!


Hey, hey, don't interrupt! I'm busy calling
bees with my beat.

...


<sp:3:0:2:0900>Come on! <sp:5:1:0>Don't look at me like that!


I know it's goofy, but I gotta try.


See, the conductor in the musical troupe
I play in has been a little down.

I figured I'd make him <clr:0000>honey crepes<clr:ffff>.
That should cheer our Mastro right up!

<sp:3:0:2:0a00>But I can't get my hands on any <clr:0000>courser
bee honey<clr:ffff>. How am I supposed to make
honey crepes without the honey?
That's why I'm trying to lure some bees
with my beat.

All I need are <clr:0000>three combs of honey<clr:ffff>...
Talk_3006:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Wait a second!


What's that I smell? Something sweet?
Hey, maybe... In your pouch there...
Talk_4012:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>It's a little hard to hear in this rain, but
the sound is a lot like a drum...

<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS>Maybe it's the one I'm destined to walk
through life with, calling to me in this
mysterious way!
I'm sure that's it. I think so anyway.


Maybe I'll have better luck finding where
it's coming from after the rain stops.
Talk_1003: <sp:3:0:2:0800>I'll bet my beat can bring those bees!
Talk_3007:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Huh. But I'd know that scent anywhere.
I love that stuff...
Talk_3008:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Greeting_00>Well, until next time, if there's a next
time! See you!
Talk_1005:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Sad>Someone said there are some beehives
around <clr:0000>Kakariko Village<clr:ffff> to the north, <clr:0000>near
that huge hole<clr:ffff> that opened up.
But that hole is pretty scary. No way I'm
going anywhere near there.
Talk_2001:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Whoa! You again, huh?


This isn't a good time. I'm busy calling
bees with my beat.

...


<sp:3:0:2:0900>Hey!<sp:5:1:0> I can see that look on your face.
It's messing with my flow!

Look, I get that I'm probably not gonna
bring any bees here like this.

But the conductor in a musical
troupe I play with has just been
a little down lately...
So I need three globs of <clr:0000>courser bee
honey<clr:ffff> for a surprise. How else am I
gonna get it?
Talk_4005:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>This rain drowned out the <clr:0000>sound of the
drum<clr:ffff> I heard earlier. I thought I could
make it out, not that far away.
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I'll look for the source later. Better to
take shelter from the rain for now.
Talk_4006:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>That sound... <sp:5:1:0>I wonder if it that really is
a <clr:0000>drum<clr:ffff> out there...<sp:0:4:0>I thought it could be close, given how
loud it was, but where's it coming from?
Talk_2003:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>*sigh* I get it that this probably isn't
gonna work to bring bees here.

But I just gotta get <clr:0000>courser bee
honey <clr:ffff>somehow.
Talk_2004:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Humming>Let's go!<sp:5:0:0> Buzz buzza dum. Buzza bee
beedum. <sp:5:0:0>Aaand...honey!<sp:5:1:0> Hm?
Talk_4008:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>You hear that? It's coming from around
here somewhere. Is that...<clr:0000>a drum<clr:ffff>?
Talk_2005:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01>I heard there are some <clr:0000>beehives<clr:ffff> around
<clr:0000>Kakariko Village<clr:ffff> to the north, <clr:0000>near
that huge hole<clr:ffff> that opened up.
But that hole is pretty scary. No way I'm
going anywhere near it.
Talk_4009:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>That sound...<sp:5:1:0> I wonder if it's <clr:0000>the sound
of a drum<clr:ffff> after all.<sp:0:4:0>I think I hear it getting louder or quieter
as I walk around. That could help find
where it's coming from...
